availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Letcher County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native.Son of Henry Quillen and Elizabeth Quillen. Resident of Letcher County, Kentucky in 1850. Farm laborer in Letcher County in 1860. Served as a private in the 13th Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) on October 4, 1862. Served as a private in the Sandy Valley Battalion of the 1st Regiment Kentucky Guards (U.S.A.) from May 10, 1864 to his desertion on September 12, 1864.

ab.bibl: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 154. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Letcher, District 2, p. 134B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Letcher, p. 694. Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 774.
